definition: to infuriate/to be furious/to die from an excess of anger
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned
constantly comparing oneself to others will only make one angry (proverb)
pinyin: ren2 bi3 ren2 , qi4 si3 ren2

sentences.english: I flew into a rage when another man stole my girlfriend!
sentences.chinese: 女朋友被別人搶走真氣死我了。

sentences.english: It is asphyxiating if one is being compared with another.
sentences.chinese: 人比人，氣死人”有對應的英語句子麼？

sentences.english: It peeves me to be ordered out of my own house.
sentences.chinese: 命令我從自己的家中出去氣死我了。

sentences.english: But now, we are very angry with her.
sentences.chinese: 而在這學期，我們可被她氣死了。
要氣死人了，什麼東西啊。

sentences.english: B: You’re going to be the death of me。
It really pisses me off when my car won't start in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 早上要是汽車發動不了，那真會把我氣死。

sentences.english: Our team's failure is very exasperating.
sentences.chinese: 我們隊失敗了，真是氣死人。

sentences.english: Cyclops It must burn you up that a boy like me saved your life huh Gotta be careful.
sentences.chinese: 像我這樣的人救了你一命你肯定氣死了吧，呵呵。

sentences.english: No sooner had I got up in the morning than Mr. Wu told me that he almost died of angry.
sentences.chinese: 有一天早晨剛起牀，吳先生就告訴我他昨天差點氣死。

sentences.english: Of course not, it's infuriating! Why wasn't he this ambitious while with me?
sentences.chinese: 真是氣死人了，爲何他跟我在一起時沒這麼有志氣？

sentences.english: Those kid will be the death of me, come home so late every night.
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子真把我氣死了，每天這麼晚纔回家。

sentences.english: When you jealous, thinking about people than people, crazy people.
sentences.chinese: 當你嫉妒時，想着人比人，氣死人。

sentences.english: Yes, yes. His father must be very angry.
sentences.chinese: 對啊，對啊，他老爸仲威一定氣死了。

definition: see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
slut/cheap person
Nyima county, Tibetan: Nyi ma rdzong in Nagchu prefecture 那曲地區|那曲地区[Na4 qu3 di4 qu1], central Tibet
(coll.) serve sb right/deservedly/ought/should
to have no sense of shame/shameless
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to lose face/humiliation
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
ma/mom/mother
rampant/unbridled/arrogant/aggressive
repulsive/vile/hateful/abominable
to have had enough of/to be fed up with/to have had one's fill of
to have nothing to say (idiom)
(spoken) why?/for which reason?
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
